questions.question: I am thinking of changing ……………………
questions.description: When we talk about changing one thing for another, we often use change with a plural object.

questions.question: I don’t …………………….. whether I lose – I am happy with what I have achieved.
questions.description: Care is used without about before a conjunction.

questions.question: I don’t ………………………… the result.
questions.description: Before an object, we use care about.

questions.question: I don’t take more than 5 minutes to ………………………… ready.
questions.description: We do not use become to talk about deliberate actions.

questions.question: The village ……………………….. I live is not far from the town.
questions.description: That can be used instead of which or whom. But it cannot be used instead of when or where.

questions.question: His recovery seemed …………………………
questions.description: After copular verbs, we use adjectives, not adverbs.

questions.question: I have bought …………………………..
questions.description: Some uncountable nouns are plural and do not have singular forms. Groceries is an example.

questions.question: The new job is not much different ………………………… the old one.
questions.description: From is generally used after different. In British English, to is also possible and in American English than is common.

questions.question: I doubt ……………………….. she will come this evening.
questions.description: We can use if, whether or that to introduce the clauses after the verb doubt.

questions.question: His success was ……………………….. his teacher.
questions.description: We can use due to after ‘be’. Owing to is not usually used like that.

questions.question: If you are not satisfied with their hospitality, you can go …………………………….
questions.description: Elsewhere means the same as somewhere else. It is slightly more formal.

questions.question: She takes ………………………. trouble over her work.
questions.description: Especial is not normally used as an adjective.
